results.title: Eat the rich
results.creator_credit: Ironfist Pictures, Tim Van Rellim and Peter Richardson
results.brief_description: From the makers of the “Comic strip” and the “Young Ones”, this black and often tasteless comedy is certain to startle. Alex, a black waiter at a celebrated restaurant for the rich called “Bastards”, is sacked. Determined to wreak revenge, he organises a people’s take over and captures the restaurant. Renaming it “Eat the Rich”, Alex and his friends serve up their own special brand of millionaires mince. Not for the faint-hearted and with a heavy metal soundtrack by Motorhead.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ironfist Pictures, Tim Van Rellim and Peter Richardson

results.title: Eat the peach
results.creator_credit: Strongbow Productions, John Kelleher and Peter Ormrod
results.brief_description: Based on a true story, Peter Ormrod’s tragi-comic tale of aspiring no-hopers follows the misadventures of two Irish villagers, Vinnie (Stephen Brennan) and Arthur (Eamon Mornsey), made unemployed by the closure of a Japanese electronics factory, who take inspiration from an old Elvis movie and blow their redundancy money on building a motorcycle “Wall of Death”. Local fame follows, but will the men have the spirit to survive if their big opening day doesn’t quite live up to their dreams? In the tradition of the Frank Capra genre this film is sure to enchant.

results.title: Eat for health. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Hugh Johnston and Suzanne Johnston
results.brief_description: Introduces the four food groups and identifies nutrients as the elements in food that help ensure good health and growth.

results.title: Eat for health
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Hal Kopel
results.brief_description: This film introduces a new approach in teaching children to eat a well balanced diet. Using the five fingers of his hand as an always available check-off device, Ralph learns to eat a balanced diet of bread and butter or margarine; milk and cheese; meat and eggs; vegetables and fruits

results.title: Easygoing: transport services for people with special needs
results.brief_description: This video provides important and practical information on the facilities available to assist people with special needs in using Victorian public transport. Through stories of five public transport users, the video highlights the varied services for improved access to public transport and outlines the plans to further improve access in the years ahead.

results.title: Easy way out
results.creator_credit: ACI Films, Temple Stemm and Sherman Beck
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the need for a constructive approach to drugs and alcohol. Through a novel analogy between the physical effort needed by chicks to hatch from eggs and the psychological effort needed by adolescents to mature, the viewer learns that struggle develops strength.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACI Films, Temple Stemm and Sherman Beck

results.title: Easy virtue
results.creator_credit: Gainsborough Pictures, M Woolf, Sir Michael Balcon and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: Based on the play by Noel Coward, Hitchcock’s version of what Coward intended as a comedy was produced as a melodrama. Larita Filton, a married woman, falls in love with a young artist. When he suicides, Larita divorces her drunken husband and travels abroad. There she meets John Whittaker who knows nothing of her past. His mother finds out the truth about Larita and compells John to divorce her. Hitchock appears in this film strolling past a tennis court. It is a must see for Hitchcock film buffs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gainsborough Pictures, M Woolf, Sir Michael Balcon and Alfred Hitchcock

results.title: Easy street [Silent version]
results.brief_description: The Tramp, played by Chaplin, reformed by angelic Edna Purviance, joins the police force and his first job is to tame the local bully (Eric Campbell). Also features Albert Austin and Henry Bergman.

results.title: Easy street [Music version]
results.brief_description: The Tramp, played by Chaplin, reformed by angelic Edna Purviance, joins the police force and his first job is to tame the local bully (Eric Campbell). Also features Albert Austin and Henry Bergman. Musical score by Winston S. Sharples. No spoken word or intertitles - music soundtrack only.

results.title: Easy self defence
results.brief_description: Shows how women can defend themselves in various situations if attacked by a male. Re-enacts typical spots where women are attacked - parks, car parks, poorly-lit areas - and then demostrates various types of movements that will de-mobilize the attacker and enable the woman to make a run for it.
